invian.analysis module#

Created on Tue May 10 12:57:54 2022

@author: alex.legariamacal

invian.analysis.contvar_peh(var_ts, var_vals, ref_ts, min_max, bin_width=False)#
invian.analysis.downsample_1d(var_ts, var_vals, bin_width)#

Downsamples 1d time series

Parameters

  • var_ts (array-like) – Variable timestamps

  • var_vals (array-like) – Variable timestamps continuous values

  • bin_width (float) – Bin width in seconds

  • return_trials (bool) – If true, returns a 2d-array where each row is a trial and each column is a time bin

Returns

  • trials_hist (2d-array) – Spiking activity around each timestamp in ref_ts

  • avg_trial (1d-array) – Average spiking activity around ref_ts

invian.analysis.smooth_units(data, sigma)#
invian.analysis.spiking_peh(spike_ts, ref_ts, min_max, bin_width, return_trials=False)#

Functiont to perform a peri-event histogram of spiking activity.

Parameters

  • spike_ts (array-like) – Spike timestamps

  • ref_ts (array-like) – Reference events that spiking will be aligned to

  • min_max (tuple) – Time window in seconds around ref_ts to be analyzed

  • bin_width (float) – Bin width in seconds

  • return_trials (bool) – If true, returns a 2d-array where each row is a trial and each column is a time bin

Returns

  • trials_hist (2d-array) – Spiking activity around each timestamp in ref_ts

  • avg_trial (1d-array) – Average spiking activity around ref_ts

invian.analysis.subtract_baseline(df, baseline=(0, 40))#
invian.analysis.zscore_df(df)#
invian.analysis.zscore_tobaseline(df, baseline=(0, 40))#
